title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against Falcons
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots extend winning streak to six after defeating Falcons, despite two costly turnovers by quarterback Drake Maye.
DeMario Douglas shines with his first career 100-yard game, including a highlight 58-yard catch setting up a score.
Falcons exploit height mismatch against Marcus Jones for two touchdowns, contributing to Jones' tough game start in November.

title: Boston residents say they feel safer downtown compared to last year in new survey
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Survey by Downtown Boston Neighborhood Association shows fewer residents feel 'less safe' downtown compared to last year.
Public safety summit addressed issues like drug use, petty crime, and road safety in downtown Boston.
While violent crimes decreased, retail theft and business barriers remain concerns, despite lower retail vacancies.

title: 10 takeaways from Patriots’ 24-23 win over the Falcons
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots won 24-23 against the Atlanta Falcons, extending their win streak to six games.
Patriots QB Drake Maye threw for 259 yards and two touchdowns but had two costly turnovers.
Falcons kicker Parker Romo missed a game-tying extra point, helping the Patriots secure the victory.

title: 10 defendants, including a grandma, indicted in statewide sex trafficking case
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Ten defendants indicted in Massachusetts for a sex trafficking case involving multiple counties.
Gianni Martinez, 23, and his grandmother Rosa Garcia, 68, face multiple trafficking-related charges.
The joint investigation involved Massachusetts State Police, FBI, and Lynn Police Department.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Miles Teller hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Miles Teller hosted 'SNL' on Nov. 2, marking his second time while Brandi Carlile was the musical guest.
The political cold open featured Teller in a mock NYC mayoral debate with Ramy Youssef and Shane Gillis.
Brandi Carlile performed for her fourth time, having previously appeared with Elton John in Season 50.

title: Regulators are limiting a proposed Eversource rate hike in Mass.
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts regulators denied part of Eversource's rate hike request, preventing a $45 million increase in revenue requirements.
Eversource requested a 13% to 17% rate hike for 300,000 NSTAR customers, citing rising gas supply and infrastructure costs.
Governor Maura Healey opposed the hikes, calling them 'outrageous' and unaffordable for Massachusetts households.

title: Wayland schools investigating after Black student targeted in racist locker room incident
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Wayland High School and police are investigating a racist incident involving a Black student's jersey found on a hanged figure.
Principal Allyson Mizoguchi condemned the act as a symbol of hate and said the students responsible have been identified.
Wayland police and the Middlesex District Attorney's Office are collaborating on the investigation, planning a community discussion.

title: Kevin Durant, Rockets pummel exhausted Celtics to snap three-game winning streak: 6 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Celtics' three-game winning streak ended with a 128-101 loss to the Rockets, led by Kevin Durant's 26 points.
Rockets capitalized on Celtics' fatigue from playing third game in four nights, showcasing strong performances from several players.
Baylor Scheierman led the Celtics with 17 points, while Derrick White and Payton Pritchard struggled with shooting accuracy.

title: Patriots elevate veteran RB D’Ernest Johnson ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Falcons
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Patriots elevate veteran RB D'Ernest Johnson from the practice squad for Sunday's game against the Atlanta Falcons.
Rhamondre Stevenson's toe injury prompted the Patriots to boost their running back depth with Johnson.
Johnson, a seven-year NFL veteran, could contribute on offense and special teams in his debut.

title: A new partnership between McAvoy, Zadorov has Bruins defense regaining some bite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins' defense improved with McAvoy and Zadorov, leading to wins after early season struggles.
Bruins' new D pairing allowed only one 5-on-5 goal in 73 minutes, excelling against top NHL lines.
Zadorov's physical play complements McAvoy's offensive aggressiveness, bolstering Boston's defensive and offensive efforts.
